org.jgrapes.portal.base

Class PortalWeblet

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jgrapes.core.internal.ComponentVertex
      • org.jgrapes.core.Component
        • org.jgrapes.portal.base.PortalWeblet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<org.jgrapes.core.ComponentType>, org.jgrapes.core.Channel, org.jgrapes.core.ComponentType, org.jgrapes.core.Eligible, org.jgrapes.core.Manager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FreeMarkerPortalWeblet

    public abstract class PortalWeblet
extends org.jgrapes.core.Component

    Provides resources using Request/Response events. Some resource requests (page resource, portlet resource) are forwarded via the Portal component to the portlets.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      protected class  PortalWeblet.PortalChannel
      The class used in handler annotations to represent the portal channel.
      class  PortalWeblet.PortalResourceChannel
      The channel used to send PageResourceRequests and PortletResourceRequests to the portlets (via the portal).

    • Method Detail

      • portalHierarchy

        protected final List<Class<?>> portalHierarchy()

        Return the list of classes that form the current portal weblet implementation. This consists of all classes from getClass() up to PortalWeblet.class.

        Returns:
        the list

      • styling

        public abstract String styling()

        Returns the name of the styling library or toolkit used by the portal. This value is informative. It may, however, be used by a PageResourceProviderFactory to influence the creation of PageResourceProviders.

        Returns:
        the value

      • setPortalSessionNetworkTimeout

        public PortalWeblet setPortalSessionNetworkTimeout(long timeout)

        Sets the portal session network timeout. The portal session will be removed if no messages have been received from the portal session for the given number of milliseconds. The value defaults to 45 seconds.

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milli seconds
        Returns:
        the portal view for easy chaining

      • portalSessionNetworkTimeout

        public long portalSessionNetworkTimeout()

        Returns the portal session network timeout.

        Returns:
        the timeout

      • setPortalSessionRefreshInterval

        public PortalWeblet setPortalSessionRefreshInterval(long interval)

        Sets the portal session refresh interval. The portal code in the browser will send a keep alive packet if there has been no user activity for more than the given number of milliseconds. The value defaults to 30 seconds.

        Parameters:
        interval - the interval in milliseconds
        Returns:
        the portal view for easy chaining

      • portalSessionRefreshInterval

        public long portalSessionRefreshInterval()

        Returns the portal session refresh interval.

        Returns:
        the interval

      • setPortalSessionInactivityTimeout

        public PortalWeblet setPortalSessionInactivityTimeout(long timeout)

        Sets the portal session inactivity timeout. If there has been no user activity for more than the given number of milliseconds the portal code stops sending keep alive packets and displays a message to the user. The value defaults to -1 (no timeout).

        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout in milliseconds
        Returns:
        the portal view for easy chaining

      • portalSessionInactivityTimeout

        public long portalSessionInactivityTimeout()

        Returns the portal session inactivity timeout.

        Returns:
        the timeout

      • prependResourceBundleProvider

        public PortalWeblet prependResourceBundleProvider(Class<?> cls)

        Prepends a class to the list of classes used to lookup portal resources. See PortalResourceBundleControl.newBundle(java.lang.String, java.util.Locale, java.lang.String, java.lang.ClassLoader, boolean). Affects the content of the resource bundle returned by portalResourceBundle(Locale).

        Parameters:
        cls - the class to prepend.
        Returns:
        the portal weblet for easy chaining

      • providePortalResource

        protected void providePortalResource(org.jgrapes.http.events.Request.In.Get event,
                                     String requestPath,
                                     org.jgrapes.io.IOSubchannel channel)

        Provide a portal resource. The implementation tries to load the resource using Class.getResource(String) for each class in the class hierarchy, starting with the finally derived class.

        Parameters:
        event - the event
        requestPath - the request path relativized to the common part for portal resources
        channel - the channel

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the portal weblet for easy chaining
